summary: App uses Internet Identity for authentication and has an admin dashboard gated by an admin allowlist; after redeploys the admin allowlist may reset, blocking admin access.
architectural_notes: Admin dashboard access is gated by an isAdmin check (e.g., useIsCallerAdmin) backed by a backend admin allowlist.
Redeploys can reset the backend admin allowlist unless it is persisted/initialized, causing loss of admin access.
known_issues: Internet Identity login/admin dashboard access may fail after redeploy because the admin principal allowlist is not recognized/reset.

existing_features.title: Add a frontend bootstrap flow that, after a successful Internet Identity login, attempts to set the current principal as admin (only when needed) and then refreshes admin-gated UI state.

new_feature_requests.summary: Make the currently logged-in Internet Identity principal an admin (restore admin dashboard access after redeploy)
Add a backend method that allows the currently logged-in Internet Identity caller to become an admin, so the admin dashboard can be accessed after a redeploy resets the admin allowlist.

projectName: Bootstrap current Internet Identity principal as admin to restore admin dashboard access
